projects.title: My Projects
projects.pageDescription: A selection of projects that demonstrate my skills in web development, design and technology.
projects.monitoringDesc: Application for monitoring weather conditions in real-time.
projects.monitoringDetails: Real-time weather monitoring system with modern microservices architecture, integrating weather data, AI analysis and gamified recommendations with Pok√©mon.
projects.refundDesc: System for managing refunds with an intuitive interface.
projects.refundDetails: A React + Vite project developed for educational purposes and development practice. The system demonstrates good practices in code organization, componentization and modern styling with TailwindCSS. The project was structured to be scalable and easy to maintain, with a clear separation between reusable components, pages, routes and utilities.
projects.restaurantDesc: API for managing table orders in a restaurant
projects.restaurantDetails: Order management API for a restaurant, developed with Node.js, Express and SQLite. The project implements a robust architecture with clear separation of responsibilities, including controllers, middlewares, routes and utilities. The API offers complete functionalities for managing products, tables, table sessions and orders, with data validation using Zod and custom error handling.
projects.coursesDetails: A REST API developed with Node.js and TypeScript for complete course and module management. The project uses Knex as a query builder for SQLite3 operations, demonstrating best practices in backend development with robust architecture, separation of responsibilities and well-documented endpoints for CRUD operations on courses and modules.
projects.ticketsDetails: A simple API in Node.js for managing support tickets. This project was created as a study to practice Node.js and RESTful API concepts.

refund.step1: The employee accesses the system and fills out the refund form.
refund.step2: The system validates the entered data and sends it for manager approval.
refund.step3: The manager reviews the request and approves or rejects the refund.
refund.step4: If approved, the finance department processes the payment to the employee.
refund.step5: The employee is notified about the refund status.

restaurant.step1: Complete management of Products, Tables and Orders.
restaurant.step4: Database migrations and seeds with Knex.
